Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Revert "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] more fixes for parallel builds (#2063)"" (#2098) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
This *partially* reverts commit 73f7f47e15495755bfd1da1448cd7d6e305fd71f.

We want the change to the test, because it was failing on MacOS.

However, I noticed a performance regression in
`ResolveLibraryProjectImports`. It went from ~1 sec to ~3 sec for me.

Since we shouldn't make our build times *worse*, let's revert this
change for now. It only *helped* parallel builds on Mac, but did not
fully fix them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Revert "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] more fixes for parallel builds (#2063)"" (#2098) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
This *partially* reverts commit 73f7f47e15495755bfd1da1448cd7d6e305fd71f.

We want the change to the test, because it was failing on MacOS.

However, I noticed a performance regression in
`ResolveLibraryProjectImports`. It went from ~1 sec to ~3 sec for me.

Since we shouldn't make our build times *worse*, let's revert this
change for now. It only *helped* parallel builds on Mac, but did not
fully fix them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Building xamarin-android from source on Windows" (#2097) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Intro

I've been attempting to follow the documentation and build xamarin-android from source in a Windows environment. For the sake of reproducibility, I'm doing this in a cloud VM (in Azure, details below). So far, I've been unable to produces a successful build by following the build documentation. I brought this up on Slack, and @JonDouglas  asked me to submit an issue here. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an new VM in Azure. Choose “Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 (latest release) on Windows Server 2016 (x64)." 
2. Either expand the OS disk, or add a disk with enough space. I added a 1024GB data disk to the vm for this task.
a. Either route you go, you’ll need to go into disk management before you get going and either expand the volume in the former case or create the volume/assign drive letter/etc in the latter.
3. The documentation on building xamarin-android in Windows says this:
a. “A simple way to ensure you have the needed dependencies on Windows is to install Visual Studio 2017 (> 15.3.x) along with the Xamarin workload. This will ensure you have the correct version of Xamarin.Android, the Android SDK, and Java needed.”
b. To this end, the first thing I did was upgrade Visual Studio. In this VM, Visual Studio comes with the full suite of workloads, so anything needing an upgrade should get upgraded. I recommend a short nap while this completes, to the extent that the caffeine levels in your bloodstream will allow.
c. At this point, I’m trusting the documentation that VS has all of the prerequisite dependencies, and running msbuild with the /t:Prepare target will download anything the system lacks. I’m not sure this is true (e.g. in the case of Autotools?), but I’m going to go with that for now.
4. Now, I’ll basically follow xamarin-android/Documentation/building/windows-instructions.md
a. Open up a Visual Studio developer terminal as an admin
b. cd to my drive (F: for me), mkdir xamarin, cd xamarin
c. git clone https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android.git
d. cd xamarin-android
e. I’m going to open VS Code to modify my Configuration.Override.props to set my toolchain directories as such:

```
<AndroidToolchainCacheDirectory>F:\android-archives</AndroidToolchainCacheDirectory>
<AndroidToolchainDirectory>F:\android-toolchain</AndroidToolchainDirectory>
```
5. Then: [using msbuild VERSION 15.8.166.59604]
a. msbuild Xamarin.Android.sln /t:Prepare
b. Prepare succeeds with these warnings:

```
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\xa-prep-tasks\xa-prep-tasks.csproj" (default target) (2) ->
(ResolveAssemblyReferences target) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targe
ts(2110,5): warning MSB3277: Found conflicts between different versions of "System.IO.Compression" that could not be re
solved.  These reference conflicts are listed in the build log when log verbosity is set to detailed. [F:\xamarin\xamar
in-android\build-tools\xa-prep-tasks\xa-prep-tasks.csproj]


"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\android-toolchain\android-toolchain.csproj" (default target) (5) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.cspro
j" (default target) (7:2) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\external\LibZipSharp\libZipSharp.csproj" (default target) (8:2) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targe
ts(2110,5): warning MSB3270: There was a mismatch between the processor architecture of the project being built "MSIL"
and the processor architecture of the reference "nunit-agent-x86", "x86". This mismatch may cause runtime failures. Ple
ase consider changing the targeted processor architecture of your project through the Configuration Manager so as to al
ign the processor architectures between your project and references, or take a dependency on references with a processo
r architecture that matches the targeted processor architecture of your project. [F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\external\L
ibZipSharp\libZipSharp.csproj]


"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\android-toolchain\android-toolchain.csproj" (default target) (5) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.cspro
j" (default target) (7:2) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\external\LibZipSharp\libZipSharp.csproj" (default target) (8:2) ->
(CoreCompile target) ->
  Native.cs(44,18): warning CS0649: Field 'Native.zip_source_args_seek_t.offset' is never assigned to, and will always
have its default value 0 [F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\external\LibZipSharp\libZipSharp.csproj]
  Native.cs(45,15): warning CS0649: Field 'Native.zip_source_args_seek_t.whence' is never assigned to, and will always
have its default value 0 [F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\external\LibZipSharp\libZipSharp.csproj]


"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\android-toolchain\android-toolchain.csproj" (default target) (5) ->

  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targe

solved.  These reference conflicts are listed in the build log when log verbosity is set to detailed. [F:\xamarin\xamar
in-android\build-tools\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.csproj]


"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->

j" (default target) (7:3) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\xa-prep-tasks\xa-prep-tasks.csproj" (default target) (2:13) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targe
ts(2110,5): warning MSB3277: Found conflicts between different versions of "System.IO.Compression" that could not be re
solved.  These reference conflicts are listed in the build log when log verbosity is set to detailed. [F:\xamarin\xamar
in-android\build-tools\xa-prep-tasks\xa-prep-tasks.csproj]


"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (Prepare target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\android-toolchain\android-toolchain.csproj" (default target) (5) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\build-tools\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.cspro
j" (default target) (7:3) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targe
ts(2110,5): warning MSB3277: Found conflicts between different versions of "System.IO.Compression" that could not be re
solved.  These reference conflicts are listed in the build log when log verbosity is set to detailed. [F:\xamarin\xamar
in-android\build-tools\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks\Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks.csproj]
```
6. This was successful, even with warnings, so I'll attempt to build.
a. msbuild Xamarin.Android.sln
b. The first time I run this, the build failed with 164 errors. I won’t c/p theme here.
c. I run msbuild Xamarin.Android.sln again. Failed with 9 errors:

```
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\Xamarin.Android.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\src\Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks\Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.csproj" (default target) (24) -
>

(CoreCompile target) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\bin\Roslyn\Microsoft.CSharp.Core.targets(
52,5): error MSB3105: The item "F:\xamarin\xamarin-android\src\Mono.Android\obj\Debug\android-24\mcw\\Android.Media.Aud
ioFocusRequest.cs" was specified more than once in the "Sources" parameter.  Duplicate items are not supported by the "

AKE_MAKE_PROGRAM=F:\android-toolchain\sdk\cmake\3.6.4111459\bin\ninja -DENABLE_NDK=OFF -DJDK_INCLUDE="C:\Program Files
(x86)\Java\jdk1.8.0_181\include C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.8.0_181\include\win32" -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=-64.cmak

p.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on dis
```

----
### Version Information
OS Name:	Microsoft Windows Server 2016 Datacenter
Version:	10.0.14393 Build 14393

Visual Studio 15.8.1
msbuild 15.8.166.59604

### Summary

Building xamarin-android from github source in (at least some) Windows environments, following the build documentation for Windows, fails. I'd love to get this working, if there are configuration changes or  additional installations I need to do. Help! Thanks in advance!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[mono-sdks] Integrate with `mono:2018-06-sdks-standalone`" (#2080) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[mono-sdks] Integrate with `mono:2018-04-sdks-anroid-standalone`" (#2096) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "[UWP] Picker placeholder text" (#3646) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

According to the documentation (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/xamarin.forms.picker.title?view=xamarin-forms#Xamarin_Forms_Picker_Title), `Title` is displayed differently. Actually, it's rendered as a `Control.Header` on UWP. Is there any specific reason for this? The combobox the `Picker` is rendered with has a proper `PlaceholderText` property and it functions flawlessly. Why isn't it used?

It's rather straightforward to work around this issue by creating a descendant of `Picker` and minimally modifying its renderer but the rationale of the original decision simply escapes me.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use a Picker.
2. Set its Title.
3. Run on UWP.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: current
- Last known good version: none

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ability to include a Tabbed Page inside a Content Page" (#3645) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi 

Is it possible to include a tabbed page inside a content page. Just like UWP where we can include pivot inside a Page. it would be helpfull to include tabbed page inside a content page . OR a new Pivot like control in xamarin forms.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom view rendering issue while converting view from Xamarin Forms to native Xamarin.Android #1967" (#2882) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

Since we are not able to reopen our previous issue report https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1967,  we have created this new issue report.

## Description
Adding a custom view to the UI doesn’t occupy the entire space (loaded a grid containing 3 labels Subject, Notes, Location within a frame). A frame is set with Padding property and Grid is loaded into Frame such that the grid inside the frame doesn’t occupy the space accordingly.

Actual issue is while converting the custom view from Xamarin forms to native android. That is, in our case we are rendering the view alone (virtually) in Xamarin forms through mapping and layouting for the custom view and parenting its children are done in native Xamarin.Android.So when it comes to Xamarin forms, parenting its children in source level is not possible ,only by setting height and width to custom view in sample level fixed the issue. Thus we have attached the sample for the mentioned issue in our earlier updates.


We have converted the custom view from Xamarin forms to native referring the below conversion.

http://michaelridland.com/xamarin/creating-native-view-xamarin-forms-viewpage/

We suspect that this is a framework issue with the Grid and positioning of the elements within a Grid. Since we tried with the same layouts directly in xamarin forms and Grid occupied the entire UI in that.UI is rendered as expected Kindly find the sample along with the screenshot for this

**Sample:**

[CustomRenderer.zip
](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1750631/CustomRenderer.zip)

**Screenshot :**
![36579997-3ec78d2e-188c-11e8-9678-6c8477ee6cc7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39787321/40778562-327ed4dc-64ef-11e8-9888-6aecab38db24.jpg)

**Steps to Reproduce**
Deploy the attached sample, in the view, a grid will be loaded in the frame according to the labels added to it.

**Expected Behavior**
Grid with labels to occupy entire Frame.

**Actual Behavior**
Grid occupies the space in the Frame according to the width and height of the labels.

Only when width request or height request is set to grid or each of the children inside the grid, expected behaviour is obtained.

**Basic Information**
Version with issue: Xamarin 2.4.0
Platform Target Frameworks:
Android: 7.1
The issue is reproduced only in Xamarin.Forms Android platform.

**Sample**

[CustomControl.zip
](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1750628/CustomControl.zip)

**Screenshot**
![36580001-40f458fc-188c-11e8-8c21-6c1af7e17364](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39787321/40778531-17718f86-64ef-11e8-8864-4fad0aee9521.jpg)

Could you please check with the above details and provide us with a possible solution for this.

**Note**: We have checked with the latest Xamarin Forms version 3.0 and issue exists in this version also.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "iOS Share Extension code does not execute in Visual Studio or Visual Studio for Mac" (#3391) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
When trying to integrate an iOS Share Extension into a Xamarin Forms Cross-Platform .NET Standard 2.0 project, the code for the default ShareViewController does not execute.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Cross-Platform project and add an iOS Share Extension project
2. When trying to share a photo from the Photo app on either the iOS Simulator or Device, the extension shows up in the Activity list, but code does not execute

### Expected Behavior
Clicking on the Share Extension activity should fire code for ViewDidLoad(), IsContentValid() and DidSelectPost()

### Actual Behavior
No breakpoints are hit on the ShareViewController class and a Debug.WriteLine test does not get executed.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms v3.1.0.637273
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio Professional 2017 v17.7.5 and Visual Studio for Mac v7.5.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  8.0 up to 11.4
 - Nuget Packages:
Microsoft.NETCore.UniversalWindowsPlatform v6.1.5
NETStandard.Library v2.0.3
Xamarin.Android.Support.v4
Xamarin.Android.Support.Design
Xamarin.Android.Support.v7.AppCompat
Xamarin.Android.Support.v7.CardView
Xamarin.Android.Support.v7.MediaRouter
Xamarin.Forms v3.1.0.637273

- Affected Devices: iOS Simulator - ALL, iPod Touch 5 iOS v9.3

### Reproduction Link
I could not post the Cross-Platform project since it is too big so I have created a Xamarin.iOS project and posted that.  The same problem occurs.
[iOSShareExtensionTest.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2228692/iOSShareExtensionTest.zip)

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TitleView #2586 : ContentView assigned to TitleView doesn stretch out across the width of the phonescreen" (#3644) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Attn : @samhouts 
I am using XF 3.2 Pre2 to display my custom navigation bar (CNB) in a TabbedPage by assigning the new property TitleView provided in the Navigation Page.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Content View xaml - "CNB.xaml". Add a simple Grid with two labels on two rows 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ContentView xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms" 
             xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             x:Class="com.IoTFier.MedGPS.Views.Common.CNB"
             NavigationPage.HasNavigationBar="False">
  <ContentView.Content>
      <StackLayout>
          <!--<Label Text="Hello Xamarin.Forms!" />-->

            <Grid BackgroundColor="White"
                  HorizontalOptions="StartAndExpand"
                  VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
                <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                    <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto"/>
                    <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto"/>
                </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
                
                <Label Grid.Row="0">Hello</Label>
                <Label Grid.Row="1">Hello2</Label>
            </Grid>
        </StackLayout>


    </ContentView.Content>
    
    
</ContentView>

2. Create a Content Page and assign to the NavigationPage.TitleView property in xaml as shown below after closing of the Content Page opening tab

    <!-- Custom Navigation Bar -->
    <NavigationPage.TitleView>
        <{your namespace alias}:CNB />
    </NavigationPage.TitleView> 

3. 



### Expected Behavior
My custom navigation bar to be stretched across the width of the screen

### Actual Behavior
Rendering of my CNB doesn't map out to match / align with the left and right edges of the phonescreen - rather I see a margin of around 10-15 points on both ends in iOS; and in Android I see a Margin of 10-15 points on the left.  See the attached screenshot.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS 15.8.1
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 --> 11.4
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 8.0
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 -->  n/a
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: 
iPhone and Android

### Screenshots
![xf3 2-titleview-cnb-creatingmargin](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26844611/44547504-ee8e7a00-a6e0-11e8-82ec-a56f7999ae96.JPG)

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS, UWP] fixes #2894 - Gestures collection changes weren't correctly propagating" (#3643) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

[UWP] - When Multiple gestures were attached to different spans the initial gestures wouldn't wire up, changes to span gestures weren't propagating

[iOS] - condensed some code and fixed issue where changes to Span Gesture Collections weren't propagating. Fixed an issue where clicking really fast in the control gallery would cause an exception because the MainPage gets swapped out after 5 clicks which would dispose of the underlying views prior to the uitouch getting dispatched

iOS testing note - Clicking on the span in iOS will probably be a little quirky but there's already an issue for that that I'm currently working on 

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #2894 

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android
- UWP

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CMSampleAttachmentKey should be public" (#4688) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Apple samples use `kCMSampleBufferAttachmentKey_CameraIntrinsicMatrix`, which AFAICT is not publicly available in Xamarin.iOS


### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Download Apple sample [Tracking the User’s Face in Real Time](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/vision/tracking_the_user_s_face_in_real_time)
2. Unzip and open ViewController.swift
3. Navigate to `captureOutput` and line 462:

```
 let cameraIntrinsicData = CMGetAttachment(sampleBuffer, key: kCMSampleBufferAttachmentKey_CameraIntrinsicMatrix, attachmentModeOut: nil)
```
4. Create a Xamarin.iOS workbook and enter what I believe to be the equivalent code in C#:

```
		var cameraIntrinsicData = CMAttachmentBearer.GetAttachment(CMSampleAttachmentKey.CameraIntrinsicMatrixKey, sampleBuffer ); // typeof(sampleBuffer) is `CVSampleBuffer`
		
```

### Expected Behavior

The code compiles.

### Actual Behavior

The compiler says "CMSampleAttachmentKey is inaccessible due to its protection level."

### Workaround

Use the hardcoded value "CameraIntrinsicMatrix"


### Environment
